title.narrative: IMPROVED GENDER- EQUITABLE OPPORTUNITIES IN EDUCATION.

description.narrative: Girls and boys, including vulnerable children, have improved gender- equitable opportunities in education., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, in particular the most marginalized and those affected by humanitarian crises, are provided with inclusive and equitable qualityeducation and learning opportunities.

sector.narrative: Digital learning materials and ICT in education
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Provision or procurement of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) learning materials
Provision or procurement of secondary education learning materials
System strengthening - gender-responsive teaching and learning (excluding SRGBV)
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Girls and boys, including vulnerable children, have improved gender- equitable opportunities in education.

description.narrative: Addressing gender-related learning bottlenecks, UNICEF is piloting a remedial education support at the school-level for improved learning while utilizing various communication means to address social norms that negatively impede girls' education, reaching more than 7,500 girls in 2020. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020

title.narrative: Gender-responsive teaching and learning systems (SP indicator)
Gender-responsive education system, for access (SP indicator)
Service Delivery - Gender - Out of school adolescent girls in the reporting year accessing formal or non-formal education with support of the UNICEF ECM programme
National education sector plan/policies supports a minimum package of gender-responsive teaching and learning
